str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To roll or gather together. From sun and strepho; to twist together, i.e. Collect.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.
A dry stick for burning. Neuter of a presumed derivative of phrugo; something desiccated, i.e. A dry twig.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fire, pile of burning fuel. From pur; a fire.
A serpent, snake, viper. Of uncertain origin; an adder or other poisonous snake.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Heat. From the base of theros; warmth.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lay hold of, fasten on to, seize, attack. From kata and haptomai; to seize upon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
